body: Find the rate of change of the area of a circle with respect to its radius r when r = 6 cm.
The volume of a cube is increasing at the rate of 9 cm³/s. How fast is the surface area increasing when the edge length is 10 cm?
The radius of a circle is increasing uniformly at the rate of 3 cm/s. Find the rate at which the area of the circle is increasing when the radius is 10 cm.
A stone is dropped into a quiet lake and waves move in circles at a speed of 5 cm/s. At the instant when the radius of the circular wave is 8 cm, how fast is the enclosed area increasing?
Find the maximum area of an isosceles triangle inscribed in the ellipse $$\frac{x^2}{a^2} + \frac{y^2}{b^2} = 1$$ with its vertex at one end of the major axis.
A window is in the form of a rectangle surmounted by a semicircular opening. The total perimeter of the window is 10 m. Find the dimensions of the window to admit maximum light through the opening.

A ladder 5 m long is leaning against a wall. The bottom of the ladder is pulled along the ground, away from the wall, at the rate of 2 cm/s. How fast is its height on the wall decreasing when the foot of the ladder is 4 m away from the wall?
Prove that the height of the cylinder of maximum volume that can be inscribed in a sphere of radius R is $$\frac{2R}{3}$$. Also, find the maximum volume.
Show that the function given by $$f(x) = \frac{\ln x}{x}$$ has a maximum at $$x = e$$.
The radius of an air bubble is increasing at the rate of 1/2 cm/s. At what rate is the volume of the bubble increasing when the radius is 1 cm?
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of the function $$f(x) = \cos^2 x + \sin x$$, for $$x \in [0, \pi]$$.
A balloon, which always remains spherical, is being inflated by pumping in 900 cm³ of gas per second. Find the rate at which the radius of the balloon increases when the radius is 15 cm.
The sum of the perimeter of a circle and a square is k, where k is a constant. Prove that the sum of their areas is least when the side of the square is double the radius of the circle.

The length of a rectangle is decreasing at the rate of 5 cm/minute, and the width is increasing at the rate of 4 cm/minute. When the length is 8 cm and width is 6 cm, find the rates of change of (a) the perimeter, and (b) the area of the rectangle.
A point on the hypotenuse of a triangle is at distance a and b from the sides of the triangle. Show that the minimum length of the hypotenuse is $$\frac{\sqrt{a^2 + b^2}}{\sqrt{3}}$$.
Let $$f(x) = x^3 - 3x + 3$$. Find all points of local maxima and minima.
Find the maximum area of a triangle that can be inscribed in a circle of radius R.
A conical tank has a radius of 3 m and a height of 9 m. Water is being poured into the tank at a rate of 5 m³/min. Find the rate at which the water level is rising when the water is 4 m deep.
Let $$f(x) = x^4 - 8x^2 + 16$$. Determine the intervals on which the function is increasing and decreasing.
Find the maximum and minimum values of $$f(x) = x - \ln x$$ for $$x > 0$$.
Prove that the function $$f(x) = e^x - x$$ is increasing on $$\mathbb{R}$$.
Show that the function given by $$f(x) = x^2 e^{-x}$$ is increasing on $$((0, \infty)$$.
Find the point on the curve $$y = \sqrt{x}$$ at which the tangent is inclined at 45° to the x-axis.
The cost of producing x items is $$C(x) = x^2 + 100x + 500$$. Find the production level that minimizes the average cost.
Prove that the function $$f(x) = \ln x - \frac{1}{x}$$ is increasing for $$x > 1$$.
Show that the radius of the cylinder of maximum volume that can be inscribed in a cone of height h and base radius R is $$\frac{2R}{3}$$.
If the radius of a circular plate increases at a constant rate of 0.1 cm/s, at what rate is the area increasing when the radius is 5 cm?
Find the maximum profit if the cost and revenue functions are $$C(x) = 500 + 20x$$ and $$R(x) = 120x - 0.5x^2$$, respectively.
A cylindrical tank with a radius of 10 m is being filled with water at the rate of 314 m³/hour. Find the rate at which the water level is rising.
